item.title: NYC authorities identify two new 9/11 victims
item.description: Sept. 11 (ZFJ) â€” The 1,648th and 1,649th victims from the World Trade Center attacks on Sept. 11, 2001, have been identified, announced the New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner on Friday, Sept. 8. These two victims are the first new identifications of 9/11 victims since September 2021. About 1,104 victims, or 40% of the 2,753 who died, remain unidentified. This year, the OCME also identified 60 human remains connected to previously identified individuals.
